summary: "Sleeping Beauty" is a classic fairy tale about a princess cursed by an evil fairy to sleep for 100 years. A good fairy makes sure everyone else in the palace and forest sleeps too, so the princess won't be alone when she wakes up. A handsome prince eventually wakes her with a kiss. The story was first written down in the 1300s and has been told and adapted many times since. It's classified as Type 410 in the Aarne-Thompson system, meaning it involves a magical sleep and awakening.
title: Sleeping Beauty
